entries.name: Age
entries: Mimiga have a lifespan of about 300 years but reach maturity slightly earlier than humans, at around 15 years of age. They are considered senior at around 200 years of age.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Mimiga are generally good, and believe in equal fairness towards all forms of life. Though they are generally lawful and value tradition as a society, Mimiga are natural pranksters at heart. Even the most benevolent individual has the occasional tendency for harmless mischief.

entries.name: Size
entries: Mimiga have similar proportions to humans but are slightly shorter, usually standing between 5 to 6 feet tall and weighing around 110 pounds at maturity. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You cannot discern colour in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Animal Whisperer
entries: You can communicate in a limited manner with mammalian beasts of Small and Tiny sizes. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you can only understand them by interpreting their gestures, body language, and movement.

entries.name: Claws
entries: You can use your claws to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Sylvan}.

entries.name: Fox's Cunning
entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Insight}.

entries.name: Crafty Magic
entries: You know the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip. You can also cast the {@spell disguise self} spell with this trait. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Cat's Talent
entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics}.

entries.name: Nine Lives
entries: You have the uncanny ability to survive deadly blows. When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can roll {@dice 1d20}. On a roll of 10 or higher, you drop to 1 hit point instead. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and once you use this trait, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn. You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Raccoon's Trickery
entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Persuasion}.

entries.name: Witty Escape
entries: You can use your friends as a distraction in an act of, not cowardice, but strategy. Once per turn, when you move out of a creature's reach, you do not provoke {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks} from it if one of your allies is within 5 feet of it. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Rabbit's Instincts
entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Perception}.

entries.name: Lucky Feet
entries: You have strong feet which carry you quickly across the ground. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your walking speed, long jump distance, and high jump height until the end of the turn. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns. You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The Kawauso Mimiga are generally good and tend towards law and neutrality, as they usually live in well-ordered communities.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.

entries.name: Otter's Vigor
entries: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Tool Mastery
entries: You gain one {@table tools|phb|tool} proficiency of your choice.

Additionally, choose one tool in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that tool, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The tool you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The Yagi Mimiga are generally good and tend towards neutrality. They see themselves less of nature's caretakers and prefer to go with the flow of nature, rather actively try to alter its course.

entries.name: Horns
entries: You can use your horns to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Goat's Tenacity
entries: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Battering Ram
entries: If you move at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hit it with a melee weapon {@action attack} on the same turn, you can immediately follow that attack with a bonus action, making one unarmed strike against the target with your horns. On a hit, you can attempt to {@action shove} the creature, and it can only make a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Independent and self-reliant, koumori mimiga are inclined towards neutrality. They live on the fringes of society and tend to avoid entanglements with other creatures.

entries.name: Fangs
entries: You can use your fangs to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Bat's Wings
entries: Thanks to your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.
While you use this flying speed, you can't make attack rolls or ability checks that require hand and arm movements, and you can't perform the somatic components of spells.

entries.name: Echolocation
entries: You can perceive your surroundings without relying on sight. While you aren't {@condition deafened}, you have {@sense blindsight} with a range of 15 feet.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of the attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Reclusive
entries: While you are in dim light or darkness, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks when you take the {@action Hide} action.
